intro: Caricina divisa, commonly known as the divided caricina, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, divided leaves that resemble those of a fern. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes. Caricina divisa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
